verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:1
verses.text: Demonstration V.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:2
verses.text: —Of Wars.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:4
verses.text: This reflection has befallen me at this time concerning the shaking that is to take place at this time, and the host that has assembled itself for the sword.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:5
verses.text: The times were disposed beforehand by God.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:6
verses.text: The times of peace are fulfilled in the days of the good and just; and the times of many evils are fulfilled in the days of the evil and transgressors.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:7
verses.text: For it is thus written:—Good must happen and blessed is he through whom it shall come to pass; and evil must happen, but woe to him through whom it shall come to pass.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:8
verses.text: Good has come to the people of God, and blessedness awaits that man through whom the good came.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:9
verses.text: And evil is stirred up as regards the host that is gathered together by means of the evil and arrogant one who glories; and woe also is there reserved for him through whom the evil is stirred up.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:10
verses.text: But do not, my beloved, reproach the evil person who has inflicted evil upon many; because the times were beforehand disposed and the time of their accomplishment has arrived.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:12
verses.text: Therefore because it is the time of the Evil One, hear in mystery that which I am writing for thee.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:13
verses.text: For thus it is written:—Whatsoever is exalted amongst men is despicable before God.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:14
verses.text: And again it is written:—Everyone who exalteth himself shall be abased, and everyone who humbleth himself shall be exalted.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:15
verses.text: Also Jeremiah said:—Let not the mighty glory in his might, nor the rich in his riches.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:16
verses.text: And again the blessed Apostle said:—Whosoever glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:17
verses.text: And David said:—I saw the wicked exalted and lifted up as the cedar of Lebanon; and when I passed by he was not, and I sought him and found him not.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:19
verses.text: For every one that glories shall be humbled.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:20
verses.text: Cain gloried over Abel his brother and slew him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:21
verses.text: And he was cursed and became a fugitive and a vagabond in the earth.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:22
verses.text: Again the Sodomites gloried over Lot, and there fell upon them fire from heaven and burned them up and their city was overthrown upon them.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:23
verses.text: And Esau gloried over Jacob and persecuted him, and Jacob received the birthright and blessings of Esau.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:24
verses.text: And the children of Jacob gloried over Joseph, and (afterwards) fell down and worshipped him in Egypt.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:25
verses.text: And Pharaoh gloried over Moses and over his people; and Pharaoh and his host were drowned in the sea.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:26
verses.text: And Dathan and Abiram gloried over Moses, and they went down alive to Sheol.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:27
verses.text: And Goliath threatened David, and he fell before him and was crushed.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:28
verses.text: And again Saul persecuted David, and he fell by the sword of the Philistines.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:29
verses.text: And Absalom exalted himself against him, and Joab slew him in the battle.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:30
verses.text: Again Benhadad gloried over Ahab, and he was delivered into the hand of Israel.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:31
verses.text: And Sennacherib blasphemed against Hezekiah and his God, and his host became dead carcases when one of the Watchers went forth and slew in the camp one hundred and eighty-five thousand at the prayer of Hezekiah and at the prayer of Prophet Isaiah, most glorious of the Prophets.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:32
verses.text: Ahab exalted himself over Micah, and he went up and fell in Ramoth Gilead.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:33
verses.text: Jezebel gloried over Elijah, and the dogs devoured her in the portion of Jezreel.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:34
verses.text: Haman gloried over Mordecai, and his iniquity turned back upon his own head.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:35
verses.text: The Babylonians gloried over Daniel and cast him into the den of lions, and Daniel came up victorious, and they were cast instead of him into the den.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:36
verses.text: Again the Babylonians gloried and accused Hananiah and his companions, and they were cast into the furnace of fire; and they came up victorious and the flame devoured the accusers.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:38
verses.text: Now Nebuchadnezzar said:—I will ascend to heaven and exalt my throne above the stars of God and sit in the lofty mountains that are in the borders of the North.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:39
verses.text: Isaiah said concerning him:—Because thy heart has thus exalted thee, therefore thou shalt be brought down to Sheol, and all that look upon thee shall be astonished at thee.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:40
verses.text: And Sennacherib also said thus:—I will go up to the summit of the mountains and to the shoulders of Lebanon.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:41
verses.text: I will dig and drink water and will dry up with my horses' hoofs all the deep rivers.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:42
verses.text: And because he thus exalted himself, Isaiah again said concerning him:—Why does the axe boast itself against him that cutteth with it, or the saw exalt itself against him that saweth with it, or the rod lift itself up against him that wieldeth it?  For thou, Sennacherib, art the axe in the hands of Him that cuts, and thou art the saw in the hands of Him that saws, and the rod in the hand of Him that wields thee for chastisement, and thou art the staff for smiting.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:43
verses.text: Thou art sent against the fickle people, and again thou art ordained against the stubborn people, that thou mayest carry away the captivity and take the spoil; and thou hast made them as the mire of the streets for all men and for all the Gentiles.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:44
verses.text: And when thou hast done all these things, why art thou exalted against Him Who holds thee, and why dost thou boast against Him Who saws with thee, and why hast thou reviled the holy city? and hast said to the children of Jerusalem:—Can your God deliver you from my hand?  And thou hast dared to say:—Who is the Lord that He shall deliver you from my hands?  Because of this, hear the word of the Lord, saying:—I will crush the Assyrian in My land, and on My mountains will I tread him down.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:45
verses.text: And when he shall have been crushed and trodden down, the Virgin, the daughter of Zion, will despise him, and the daughter of Jerusalem will shake her head and say:—Whom hast thou reviled and blasphemed, and against whom hast thou lifted up thy voice?  Thou hast lifted up thine eyes towards heaven against the Holy One of Israel, and by the hands of thy messengers thou hast reviled the Lord.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:46
verses.text: Now see that the hook has been forced into thy nostrils, and the bridle into thy lips, and thou hast turned back with thine heart crushed, who camest with thine heart uplifted.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:47
verses.text: And his slaying was by the hands of his loved ones; and in the house of his confidence, there was he overthrown, and fell before his god.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:48
verses.text: And truly it was right, my beloved, that his body should thus become a sacrifice and offering before that god on whom he relied, and in his temple, as a memorial for his idol.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:50
verses.text: Again the ram was lifted up and exalted, and pushed with its horns towards the west, and towards the north, and towards the south, and humbled many beasts.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:51
verses.text: And they could not stand before him, until the he-goat came from the west and smote the ram and broke his horns and humbled the ram completely.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:52
verses.text: But the ram was the King of Media and Persia, that is, Darius; and the he-goat was Alexander, the son of Philip, the Macedonian.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:53
verses.text: For Daniel saw the ram when he was in the East before the gate of Shushan the fortress that is in the province of Elam, upon the river Ulai.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:54
verses.text: And he was pushing towards the West and towards the North and towards the South.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:55
verses.text: And none of the beasts could stand before him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:56
verses.text: And the he-goat of the goats came up from the region of the Greeks, and exalted himself against the ram.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:57
verses.text: And he smote him and broke both his horns, the greater and the lesser.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:58
verses.text: And why did he say that he broke both his horns?  Clearly because he humbled both the kingdoms which he ruled; the lesser, that of the Medes, and the greater, that of the Persians.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:59
verses.text: But when Alexander the Greek came, he slew Darius, King of Media and Persia.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:60
verses.text: For thus the angel said to Daniel, when he was explaining the vision to him:—The ram that thou sawest was the King of Media and Persia, and the he-goat the King of the Greeks.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:61
verses.text: Now, from the time that the two horns of the ram were broken, until this time, there have been six hundred and forty-eight years.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:63
verses.text: Therefore, as for the ram, its horns are broken.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:64
verses.text: And though its horns are broken, lo! it exalts and uplifts itself against the fourth beast, that is strong and mighty and its teeth of iron and its hoofs of brass, and it shall devour and grind down, and trample with its feet whatsoever remaineth.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:65
verses.text: O Ram, whose horns are broken, rest thou from the beast, and provoke it not lest it devour thee and grind thee to powder.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:66
verses.text: The ram could not stand before the he-goat; how shall it stand before that terrible beast, whose mouth speaketh great things, and whatsoever it finds it couches over as a lion over his prey?  Whoever provokes the lion becomes its portion; and whoever stirs up that beast, it shall devour him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:67
verses.text: And who is there that shall escape out from under the feet of that beast when it is trampling on him?  For the beast shall not be slain until the Ancient of Days shall sit upon the throne, and the Son of Man shall come near before Him, and authority shall be given to Him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:68
verses.text: Then shall that beast be slain and its carcase shall perish.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:69
verses.text: And the Kingdom of the Son of Man shall be established, an eternal Kingdom, and His authority from generation to generation.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:71
verses.text: Be quiet, O thou that dost exalt thyself; vaunt not thyself!  For if thy wealth has lifted up thy heart, it is not more abundant than that of Hezekiah, who went in and boasted of it before the Babylonians, (yet) it was all of it carried away and went to Babylon.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:72
verses.text: And if thou gloriest in thy children, they shall be led away from thee to the Beast, as the children of King Hezekiah were led away, and became eunuchs in the palace of the King of Babylon.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:73
verses.text: And if thou dost glory in thy wisdom, thou dost not in it excel the Prince of Tyre, whom Ezekiel reproached, saying unto him:—Art thou wiser than Daniel, or hast thou seen by thy wisdom the things that are hid?  And if thy mind is puffed up by thy years, that they are many; they are not more in number than those of the Prince of Tyre who ruled the Kingdom during the days of twenty-two Kings of the house of Judah, that is, for four hundred and forty years.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:74
verses.text: And since the years of that King of Tyre were many, all the time he thus said in his heart, I am God and sit in the seat of God in the heart of the seas.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:75
verses.text: But Ezekiel said to him:  Thou art a man and thou art not God.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:76
verses.text: For while the Prince of Tyre was walking without fault in the midst of the stones of fire, there was mercy upon him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:77
verses.text: But when his heart was lifted up, the cherub who overshadoweth, destroyed him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:79
verses.text: Now, what are the stones of fire, but the children of Zion and the children of Jerusalem?  For in the ancient time, in the days of David and of Solomon his son, Hiram was a friend to those of the house of Israel.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:80
verses.text: But when they were carried away captive from their place, he rejoiced over them and spurned them with his feet, and did not remember the friendship of the house of David.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:81
verses.text: And as to that which I said that the children of Judah were called the stones of fire, it was not of my own thought that I said it, but Jeremiah the Prophet spake concerning them; for when he was calling forth tears for them in the Lamentations, he said:—The children of Zion were more excellent than precious stones.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:82
verses.text: And again he said:—How are the stones of the Sanctuary cast down at the head of all the streets?  And again He said by the Prophet:—The stones were holy that were cast down in his land.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:83
verses.text: And as to these very stones, the fire was burning in them, as Jeremiah said:—The word of the Lord became in my heart like burning fire and it was hot in my bones.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:84
verses.text: And again He said to Jeremiah:—Lo! I give My word in thy mouth as fire, and this people shall be as wood.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:85
verses.text: And again He said words shall go forth as fire, and as iron that cutteth the stone.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:86
verses.text: On this account the Prophets, amongst whom Hiram the Prince of Tyre was walking, were called stones of fire.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:88
verses.text: And again (God) said to him:—Thou wast with the Cherub who was anointed and overshadowing.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:89
verses.text: For the king, who was anointed with the holy oil, was called a Cherub.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:90
verses.text: And he was overshadowing all his people, as Jeremiah said:—The anointed of the Lord is the breath of our nostrils, he of whom we said that in his shadow shall we live amongst the Gentiles.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:91
verses.text: For they were sitting in the shadow of the king, while he was standing at their head.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:92
verses.text: And when the crown of their head fell, they were without shade.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:93
verses.text: And if any one should say that this word is spoken concerning Christ, let him receive that which I write for him without disputation, and thus he will be persuaded that it was said with reference to the king.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:94
verses.text: For Jeremiah said in behalf of the people:—Woe unto us, for the crown of our head has fallen!  But Christ has not fallen, because He rose again the third day.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:95
verses.text: For the king fell from the house of Judah, and never again was their kingdom set up.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:96
verses.text: And as for that He said again:—I will destroy the overshadowing Cherub.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:97
verses.text: For the Cherub that He will destroy is Nebuchadnezzar, as it is written:—He performed a work in Tyre, and there was given him by Tyre no hire for his host, and in return for the work of Tyre there was given him the land of Egypt.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:98
verses.text: And why was hire not given by Tyre to Nebuchadnezzar?  Clearly because its wealth went away in the sea, so that Nebuchadnezzar did not receive it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:99
verses.text: And at that time He destroyed the overshadowing Cherub, which is Nebuchadnezzar.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:100
verses.text: For there are two Cherubs, one anointed and overshadowing, and one overshadowing but not anointed.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:101
verses.text: For He said above:—Thou wast with the Cherub anointed and overshadowing.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:102
verses.text: And lower down He said:—I will destroy thee the overshadowing Cherub; and did not say "anointed".

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:103
verses.text: For Nebuchadnezzar was not anointed; but David and Solomon were, and the other kings who arose after them.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:104
verses.text: And how was Nebuchadnezzar called overshadowing?  Clearly on account of the vision of the tree, when he saw a tree in the midst of the earth, beneath which dwelt all the beasts of the wilderness and on its branches dwelt all the birds of heaven, and from it all flesh was fed.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:105
verses.text: When Daniel interpreted his dream to him, Daniel said to him:—Thou art the tree, that tree which thou sawest in the midst of the earth and beneath thee dwell all the nations.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:106
verses.text: On this account he was the overshadowing Cherub; who destroyed the Prince of Tyre, because he rejoiced over the children of Israel, for that they were carried away captive from their land, and because his heart was exalted.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:107
verses.text: This Tyre also lay waste seventy years like Jerusalem which sat in desolation seventy years.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:108
verses.text: For Isaiah said concerning it:—Tyre shall wander seventy years, as the days of one king, and shall commit fornication with all the kingdoms that are upon the face of the earth.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:110
verses.text: O thou that art exalted and lifted up, let not the vaunting of thine heart mislead thee, nor say thou, I will go up against the rich land and against the powerful beast.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:111
verses.text: For that beast will not be slain by the ram seeing that its horns are broken.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:112
verses.text: For the he-goat broke the horns of the ram.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:113
verses.text: Now the he-goat has become the mighty beast.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:114
verses.text: For when the children of Japhet held the kingdom, then they slew Darius, the king of Persia.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:115
verses.text: Now the fourth beast has swallowed up the third.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:116
verses.text: And this third consists of the children of Japhet, and the fourth consists of the children of Shem, for they are the children of Esau.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:117
verses.text: Because, when Daniel saw the vision of the four beasts, he saw first the children of Ham, the seed of Nimrod, which the Babylonians are; and secondly, the Persians and Medes, who are the children of Japhet; and thirdly, the Greeks, the brethren of the Medes; and fourthly, the children of Shem, which the children of Esau are.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:118
verses.text: For a confederacy was formed between the children of Japhet and the children of Shem.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:119
verses.text: Then the government was taken away from the children of Japhet, the younger, and was given to Shem, the elder; and to this day it continues, and will continue for ever.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:120
verses.text: But when the time of the consummation of the dominion of the children of Shem shall have come, the Ruler, who came forth from the children of Judah, shall receive the kingdom, when He shall come in His second Advent.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:122
verses.text: For in the vision of Nebuchadnezzar, when he saw it, which Daniel made known and showed to Nebuchadnezzar, when he saw the image which stood over against him, the head of the image was of gold, and its breast and arms of silver, and its belly and thighs of brass, and its legs and feet of iron and potter's clay.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:123
verses.text: And Daniel said to Nebuchadnezzar:—Thou art the head of gold.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:124
verses.text: And why was he called the head of gold?  Was it not because the word of Jeremiah was fulfilled in him?  For Jeremiah said:—Babylon is a golden cup in the hand of the Lord, that makes all the earth to drink of its wine.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:125
verses.text: And also Babylon was called the head of all the kingdoms, as it is written:—Babylon was the head of the of Nimrod.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:127
verses.text: And he said that the breast and the arms of the image were of silver.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:128
verses.text: This signified concerning a kingdom which was inferior to it; namely, Darius the Mede.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:129
verses.text: For (God) put the kingdom into the balance.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:130
verses.text: For the kingdom of the house of Nimrod was weighed and was found wanting.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:131
verses.text: And since it was wanting, Darius received it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:132
verses.text: Because of this he said that his kingdom was inferior.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:133
verses.text: And because it was inferior, the children of Media did not rule in all the earth.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:134
verses.text: Now the belly and thighs of the image were of brass, and he said:—The third kingdom shall rule in all the earth.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:135
verses.text: It is the kingdom of the children of Javan, who are children of Japhet.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:136
verses.text: For the children of Javan came in against the kingdom of their brethren.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:137
verses.text: For Madai and Javan are sons of Japhet.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:138
verses.text: But Madai was foolish and incapable of governing the kingdom, until Javan, his brother came, who was wise and cunning, to destroy the kingdom.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:139
verses.text: For Alexander, son of Philip, ruled in all the earth.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:141
verses.text: And the legs and feet of the image were of iron.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:142
verses.text: This is the kingdom of the children of Shem, who are the children of Esau, which is strong as iron.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:143
verses.text: And he said:—As iron breaks and subdueth everything, so also the fourth kingdom shall break and bruise everything.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:144
verses.text: And he explained with reference to the feet and toes, that part of them was of iron and part of them of potter's clay.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:145
verses.text: For he said:—Thus they shall be mingled with the seed of man, and they shall not cleave one to another, as iron cannot be mixed with clay.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:146
verses.text: This referred to the fourth kingdom.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:147
verses.text: Because in the kingdom of the children of Esau there was not a king, the son of a king, established to govern the kingdom; but when the children of Esau were gathered together into a powerful city, then they made a senate.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:148
verses.text: And from thence they used to set up as chief of the city a wise man to govern the kingdom, lest when the Governor of their kingdom should weigh them, they might be found wanting, and the kingdom might be taken away from them as the kingdom of the children of arrogant Nimrod was taken away and given to the children of foolish Madai.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:149
verses.text: And this king who was set up, the seed of that former king was destroying him; and they did not cleave one to another.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:150
verses.text: But as to the seed of man which is compared with the clay, the meaning is this; that when the king was chosen for the kingdom, he mingled himself with the root of the kingdom of iron.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:152
verses.text: And he showed that in the days of those kings, who shall arise in the kingdom, the God of heaven will set up a kingdom which shall not be destroyed and shall not pass away for ever.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:153
verses.text: This is the Kingdom of King Messiah, which is that which shall cause the fourth kingdom to pass away.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:154
verses.text: And above he said:—Thou sawest a stone which was cut out, but not by hands; and it smote the image upon its feet of iron and potter's clay and broke them to pieces.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:155
verses.text: Now he did not say that it smote upon the head of the image, nor on its breast and arms, nor yet on its belly and thighs, but on its feet; because that, of the whole image, that stone when it comes will find the feet alone.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:156
verses.text: And in the next verse he said:—The iron and the brass and the silver and the gold were broken to pieces together.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:157
verses.text: For after them, when King Messiah shall reign, then He will humble the fourth kingdom, and will break the whole image; for by the whole image the world is meant.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:158
verses.text: Its head is Nebuchadnezzar; its breast and arms the King of Media and Persia; its belly and thighs the King of the Greeks; its legs and feet the kingdom of the children of Esau; the stone, which smote the image and brake it, and with which the whole earth was filled, is the kingdom of King Messiah, Who will bring to nought the kingdom of this world, and He will rule for ever and ever.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:160
verses.text: Again hear concerning the vision of the four beasts which Daniel saw coming up out of the sea and diverse one from another.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:161
verses.text: This is the appearance of them:—The first was like a lion, and it had the wings of an eagle.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:162
verses.text: And I saw that its wings were plucked away, and it stood up like a man upon its feet, and the heart of a man was given to it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:163
verses.text: And the second beast was like a bear, and it raised itself up upon one side and there were three ribs in its mouth between its teeth.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:164
verses.text: And the third beast was like a leopard, and it had four wings and four heads.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:165
verses.text: And the fourth beast was exceedingly terrible and strong and powerful, and it had great teeth.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:166
verses.text: It devoured and brake to pieces, and whatsoever remained, it stamped with its feet.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:167
verses.text: Now the great sea that Daniel saw is the world:  and these four beasts are the four kingdoms signified above.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:169
verses.text: Now as to the first beast, he said concerning it, that it was like a lion, and it had the wings of an eagle.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:170
verses.text: For the first beast was the kingdom of Babylon, which was like a lion.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:171
verses.text: For thus Jeremiah wrote saying:—Israel is a wandering sheep.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:172
verses.text: The lions caused them to wander.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:173
verses.text: First the king of Assyria devoured him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:174
verses.text: And this last was stronger than he, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:175
verses.text: So Jeremiah called him a lion.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:176
verses.text: And he said:—He has the wings of an eagle.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:177
verses.text: For thus it is written that, when Nebuchadnezzar went out to the wilderness with the beasts, he grew hair like (the plumage) of an eagle.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:178
verses.text: And he said:—I saw that its wings were plucked away and it stood upright upon its feet as a man, and a man's heart was given to it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:179
verses.text: For first, in the vision of the image, he was compared to gold which is more precious than anything which is used in the world.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:180
verses.text: So in the vision of the beasts he is compared to a lion which excels in its might all the beasts.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:181
verses.text: And again he was compared to an eagle which surpasses every bird.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:182
verses.text: Whatsoever was written about him was fulfilled in him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:183
verses.text: For the Lord said concerning him:—I have placed a yoke of iron upon the neck of all the nations, and they shall serve the king of Babylon seventy years.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:184
verses.text: And also the beasts of the desert and the birds of heaven have I given to him to serve him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:185
verses.text: For since the king was like the head of gold, men served him as a king.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:186
verses.text: And when he went out to the wilderness, the beasts served him as a lion.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:187
verses.text: And when his hair was like (the plumage) of an eagle, the birds of heaven served him as an eagle.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:188
verses.text: But when his heart was lifted up, and he knew not that the power was given to him from heaven, the yoke of iron was broken from the neck of men, and he went forth with the beasts, and instead of the heart of a king there was given him the heart of a lion.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:189
verses.text: And when he was lifted up over the beasts, the heart of a lion was taken away from him, and there was given him the heart of a bird.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:190
verses.text: And when wings grew upon him like those of an eagle, he exalted himself over the birds.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:191
verses.text: And then his wings also were plucked away and there was given to him a humble heart.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:192
verses.text: And when he knew that the Most High has authority in the kingdom of man, to give it to whomsoever He will, then as a man he praised Him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:194
verses.text: And as for the second beast, he said concerning him that it was like a bear and raised itself up upon one side.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:195
verses.text: Because when the kingdom of Media and Persia arose, it arose in the east.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:196
verses.text: And three ribs were in its mouth.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:197
verses.text: Because the ram was pushing towards the West and towards the North and towards the South, towards three winds of heaven.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:198
verses.text: These three winds it held, and pushed against, like the three ribs that were in the mouth of the bear; until the he-goat came forth from the west, and smote the ram and took out the ribs that were in his mouth.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:200
verses.text: And concerning the third beast he said that it was like a leopard, and it had four birds' wings on its back and that beast had four heads.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:201
verses.text: Now this third beast was Alexander the Macedonian.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:202
verses.text: For he was strong as a leopard.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:203
verses.text: And as for the four wings and the four heads that the beast had, that was because he gave the kingdom to his four friends to govern after him, when he had come and slain Darius and reigned in his stead.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:205
verses.text: And of the fourth beast he said that it was exceedingly terrible and strong and mighty, devouring and crushing and trampling with its feet anything that remained.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:206
verses.text: It is the kingdom of the children of Esau.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:207
verses.text: Because after that Alexander the Macedonian became king, the kingdom of the Greeks was founded, since Alexander also was one of them, even of the Greeks.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:208
verses.text: But the vision of the third beast was fulfilled in him, since the third and the fourth were one.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:209
verses.text: Now Alexander reigned for twelve years.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:210
verses.text: And the kings of the Greeks arose after Alexander, being seventeen kings, and their years were two hundred and sixty-nine years from Seleucus Nicanor to Ptolemy.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:211
verses.text: And the Caesars were from Augustus to Philip Caesar, seventeen kings.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:212
verses.text: And their years are two hundred and ninety-three years; and eighteen years of Severus.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:214
verses.text: For Daniel said:—I was considering the ten horns that were upon the head of the beast.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:215
verses.text: For the ten horns were ten kings who arose at that time until Antiochus.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:216
verses.text: And he said:—A little horn arose from between those ten and three fell before it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:217
verses.text: For when Antiochus arose in the kingdom, he humbled three kings, and he exalted himself against the saints of the Most High and against Jerusalem.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:218
verses.text: And he defiled the sanctuary.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:219
verses.text: And he caused the sacrifice and the offerings to cease for a week and half a week, namely, for ten and a-half years.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:220
verses.text: And he brought in fornicators into the house of the Lord, and he caused the observances of the Law to cease.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:221
verses.text: And he slew righteous men and gave them to the birds of heaven and to the beasts of the earth.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:222
verses.text: For in his days was fulfilled the word that David spoke:—O God, the Gentiles have come into thine inheritance, and have defiled Thy holy temple.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:223
verses.text: They have made Jerusalem desolate.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:224
verses.text: They have given the dead bodies of Thy servants as food to the birds of heaven, and the flesh of Thy righteous ones to the beasts of the earth.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:225
verses.text: They have poured out their blood like water round about Jerusalem, and there is none to bury them.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:226
verses.text: For this was accomplished at that time, when the venerable and aged Eleazar was slain, and the sons of the blessed Samuna, seven in number, and when Judas (Maccabeus) and his brethren were struggling on behalf of their people, when they were dwelling in hiding-places.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:227
verses.text: At that time the horn made war with the saints, and their power prevailed.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:228
verses.text: And the wicked Antiochus spake words against the Most High, and changed the times and the seasons.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:229
verses.text: And he made to cease the covenant of Abraham, and abolished the Sabbath of rest.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:230
verses.text: For he commanded the Jews that they should not circumcise.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:231
verses.text: Therefore, (the Prophet) said concerning him;—He shall think to change the times and the seasons and the laws, and they were given into his hand for a time, times, and half a time.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:232
verses.text: Now the time and half a time is the week and a half, which is ten years and a half.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:233
verses.text: Again he said:—The judgment was set and they took away his authority from him, to injure and destroy him until the end of the kingdom.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:234
verses.text: For the judgment came upon Antiochus, a judgment from heaven; and he became sick with a grievous and evil sickness, and on account of the smell of him as he rotted, no man could approach him, for worms were crawling and falling from him and eating his flesh because he oppressed the worm Jacob.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:235
verses.text: And his flesh rotted in his lifetime, because he caused the dead bodies of the sons of Jerusalem to rot and they were not buried.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:236
verses.text: And he became defiled in his own eyes, because he had defiled the sanctuary of God.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:237
verses.text: And he prayed and was not heard, because he did not hearken to the groanings of the righteous whom he slew.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:238
verses.text: For he wrote a letter and sent it to the Jews and called them "my friends," but God had not mercy on him, but he died in his torment.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:240
verses.text: He said again:—The saints of the Most High shall receive the Kingdom.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:241
verses.text: What shall we say concerning this?  Have the children of Israel received the Kingdom of the Most High?  God forbid.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:242
verses.text: Or has that people come upon the clouds of heaven?  This has passed away from them.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:243
verses.text: For Jeremiah said concerning them:—Call them rejected silver, for the Lord has rejected them.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:244
verses.text: Again he said:—He will not again regard them.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:245
verses.text: And Isaiah said concerning them:—Pass by; pass by; approach not the defiled.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:246
verses.text: And concerning the saints of the Most High (Daniel) said thus:—They shall inherit the Kingdom for ever.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:247
verses.text: For these rested a little from the burden of kings and princes, namely, from after the death of Antiochus till the sixty-two weeks were fulfilled.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:248
verses.text: And the Son of Man came to free them and gather them together, but they did not receive Him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:249
verses.text: For He came to obtain fruit from them, and they did not give it to Him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:250
verses.text: For their vines were of the vine of Sodom and of the stock of Gomorrha, a vineyard in which thorns grew, and which bore wild grapes.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:251
verses.text: Their vine was bitter, and their fruit sour.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:252
verses.text: The thorns could not be softened, nor could the bitterness change to the nature of wine, nor could the sour fruit change to a sweet nature.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:254
verses.text: For Isaiah first set men of Judah as judges over them, and there was planted amongst them a new and beloved planting.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:255
verses.text: But these are those judges who shall sit on twelve thrones and judge their twelve tribes.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:256
verses.text: And thus He said to the judges:—Judge between Me and My vineyard, what further, O ye judges, should I have done to My vineyard, that I did not do?  For lo! I planted it with vine scions, and they became strange vines.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:257
verses.text: I surrounded it with a fence of heavenly Watchers and I built its tower, the holy Temple.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:258
verses.text: And I dug out its winepress, the baptism of the priests.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:259
verses.text: And I brought down rain upon it, the words of My Prophets.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:260
verses.text: And I pruned it and trimmed it, from the works of the Amorites.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:261
verses.text: I looked that it should produce grapes of righteousness, and it produced wild grapes of iniquity and sin.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:262
verses.text: I looked for judgment and behold oppression, and for righteousness and there was a cry.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:263
verses.text: Hear, O ye judges, what I will do to My vineyard.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:264
verses.text: I will break open its fence, and it shall be for down-treading.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:265
verses.text: And I will tear down its tower, and it shall be for pillage.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:266
verses.text: And I will make it to become a desert because it produced wild grapes.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:267
verses.text: And it shall not be dressed and it shall not be pruned.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:268
verses.text: And thorns and weeds shall grow up in it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:269
verses.text: And I will command the clouds that they send not down rain upon it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:270
verses.text: For the heavenly Watchers departed from the fence of the vineyard; and the mighty tower on which they relied was torn down.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:271
verses.text: The winepress, the cleansing away of their offences, was overthrown.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:272
verses.text: When the vine was without blemish, it did not prove of service.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:273
verses.text: Now that the fire has devoured it and that it is laid waste, how shall it prove of service?  The fire has devoured its two branches and its inward parts are wasted.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:274
verses.text: For its two branches are the two kingdoms, and its inward part which is laid waste is Jerusalem.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:275
verses.text: Many servants were sent to them by the Lord of the vineyard.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:276
verses.text: And they slew them and did not send the fruit to the Lord of the vineyard.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:277
verses.text: After the servants the beloved Son was sent, to receive from them the fruit and to bring it back to Him that sent Him.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:278
verses.text: And they seized Him and cast Him out of the vineyard; and they cut spikes from the thorns of the vineyard and fixed them in His hands.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:279
verses.text: And He was hungry and asked food of them; and they took and gave Him gall from the fruit of the vineyard.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:280
verses.text: He was thirsty and asked of them drink; and they gave Him vinegar and He would not drink it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:281
verses.text: And they platted a crown of thorns that had sprung up in the vineyard, and placed it on the head of the Son of the Lord of the vineyard.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:282
verses.text: For from the time that the vineyard was made, it displayed these fruits.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:283
verses.text: Therefore its Lord uprooted it and cast it in the fire; and planted good fruit-bearing vines in the vineyard, and such as gladden the husbandman.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:284
verses.text: For Christ is the vineyard, and His Father is the husbandman; and they who drink of His cup are the vines.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:285
verses.text: Therefore vineyard was formed instead of vineyard.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:286
verses.text: And furthermore at His coming He handed over the kingdom to the Romans, as the children of Esau are called.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:287
verses.text: And these children of Esau will keep the kingdom for its giver.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:289
verses.text: And the holy People inherited an eternal Kingdom; the holy people who were chosen instead of the People.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:290
verses.text: For He provoked them to jealousy with a people that was not a people.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:291
verses.text: And with a foolish people He angered them.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:292
verses.text: And He set free the holy people.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:293
verses.text: For lo! every covenant of God is freed from the burden of kings and princes.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:294
verses.text: For even if a man has served the heathen, as soon as ever he draws nigh unto the covenant of God, he is set free.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:295
verses.text: But the Jews are toiling in bondage amongst the Gentiles.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:296
verses.text: For thus he said about the Saints;—They shall inherit the Kingdom that is beneath the heaven.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:297
verses.text: But if he had said it about them (the Jews), why are they toiling in service amongst the Gentiles?  And if they say that it has not taken place as yet; then (we ask) is the Kingdom that shall be given to the Son of man, to be heavenly or earthly?  And lo! the children of the Kingdom are sealed, and they have received their emancipation from this world.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:298
verses.text: For since it exists now, it will not be willing to be subjected to the power of the King, Who shall come and take to Himself His Kingdom.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:299
verses.text: But it will guard His pledges with honour, that when He shall come to bring to nought the Kingdom, he may come upon them not in anger.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:300
verses.text: For when He, Whose is the Kingdom, shall come in His second coming, He will take to Himself whatever He has given.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:301
verses.text: And He Himself will be King for ever and ever.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:302
verses.text: And His Kingdom shall not pass away, because it is an eternal Kingdom.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:304
verses.text: For first, He gave the Kingdom to the sons of Jacob, and subdued to them the children of Esau; as Isaac said to Esau:—Thou shalt serve Jacob thy brother.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:305
verses.text: And when again they did not prosper in the Kingdom, He took it away from the children of Jacob and gave it to the children of Esau until He should come Whose it is.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:306
verses.text: And they will deliver up the deposit to its Giver, and will not deal fraudulently with it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:307
verses.text: And the Guardian of the Kingdom is subject to Him to Whom all things are subject.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:308
verses.text: Therefore this Kingdom of the children of Esau shall not be delivered up into the hand of the hosts that are gathered together, that desire to go up against it; because the Kingdom is being kept safe for its Giver, and He Himself will preserve it.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:309
verses.text: And as to this that I wrote to thee, beloved, that the Kingdom of the children of Esau is being kept safe for its Giver, doubt not about it, that that Kingdom will not be conquered.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:310
verses.text: For a mighty champion Whose name is Jesus shall come with power, and bearing as His armour all the power of the Kingdom.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:311
verses.text: And search out and see that also by the poll-tax He was enrolled amongst them.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:312
verses.text: And as He was enrolled by the poll-tax amongst them, He will also succour them.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:313
verses.text: And His standard abounds in that place, and they are clothed in His armour, and shall not be found wanting in war.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:314
verses.text: And if thou shouldest say unto me:—"In the years of the Kings that preceded these, why did they conquer and subdue the beast?"  It was because the chiefs and kings who stood up at that time in the Kingdom of the children of Esau did not wish to lead with them to the war the Man who was enrolled with them in the poll-tax.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:315
verses.text: Therefore the beast was subdued a little, but was not slain.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:317
verses.text: But concerning these things that I have written for thee, my beloved, namely, concerning that which is written in Daniel, I have not brought them to an end, but (have stopped) short of the end.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:318
verses.text: And if any man dispute about them, say thus to him, that these words are not concluded, because the words of God are infinite, nor will they be concluded.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:319
verses.text: For the foolish man says, "Here unto (these) words reach".

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:320
verses.text: And again, it is not possible to add to them or to diminish from them.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:321
verses.text: For the riches of God cannot be computed or limited.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:322
verses.text: For if thou take away water from the sea, the deficiency will be imperceptible.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:323
verses.text: And if thou remove sand from the sea-shore, its measure will not be diminished.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:324
verses.text: And if thou count the stars of heaven, thou wilt not arrive at the sum of them.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:325
verses.text: And if thou kindle fire from a burning, it will not a whit be lessened.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:326
verses.text: And if thou receive of the Spirit of Christ, Christ will not a whit be diminished.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:327
verses.text: And if Christ dwell in thee, yet He will not be completed in thee.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:328
verses.text: And if the sun enter the windows of thy house, yet the sun in its entirety will not come to thee.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:329
verses.text: And all these things that I have enumerated for thee were created by the word of God.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:330
verses.text: Therefore know thou, that, as concerning the word of God no man has reached or will reach its end.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:331
verses.text: Therefore, have thou no disputation about these things, but say:—"These things are so.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:332
verses.text: That is enough".

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:333
verses.text: But hear these things from me, and also enquire about them of our brethren, children of our faith.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:334
verses.text: But whosoever shall mock at the words of his brother, even if he say, "mine are wise," yet hearken not to his words.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:335
verses.text: And concerning what I wrote to thee about these forces that are being stirred up to war, it is not as though anything has been revealed to me that I have made known these things to thee, but attend to the words at the head of the letter:—Every one who exalteth himself shall be humbled.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:336
verses.text: For even if the forces shall go up and conquer, yet know that it is a chastisement of God; and though they conquer, they shall be condemned in a righteous judgment.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:337
verses.text: But yet be thou assured of this, that the beast shall be slain at its (appointed) time.

verses.name: Aphrahat: Of Wars 1:338
verses.text: But do thou, my brother, at this time be earnest in imploring mercy, that there may be peace upon the people of God.
